node.title: Security forces fire tear gas, arrest doens of protesters in Burkina Faso
node.alt: A man yells as he walks past a pile of burning tyres.
node.description: Protesters are angry at the government's inability to stem violence linked to Al Qaeda and the Islamic State group.
node.content:
["Protesters have burned tyres and pillaged a government building in Burkina Faso's capital after police fired tear gas to disperse a\u00a0crowd calling for the country's President to resign.", "Tensions are high in the country, with people angry at the government's inability to stem terrorist attacks and violence linked to Al Qaeda and the Islamic State group.", "\"We are marching, we are protesting today, to demand our rights as Burkinabe people,\" said demonstrator Souleyman Kone.", "\"They are our brothers, our soldiers who are dying.\"", "Activist groups called for renewed protests in response to a recent surge of attacks in the West African country, including one by an Al Qaeda-linked group that killed 49 military police officers and four civilians two weeks ago.", "The assault near the northern town of Inata was the deadliest Burkinabe security forces have suffered since an insurgency broke out in 2015 and has fuelled anger against the government and the French military forces that support it.", "Since then, there have been scattered protests against President Roch Kabore's government.", "On Saturday morning, military police officers launched tear gas canisters as\u00a0protesters erected barricades and burned tyres and trash cans in the capital Ouagadougou.", "", "
The protest comes after the deadliest attack in years against the security forces.(AP:\u00a0Sophie Garcia)
", "Some demonstrators later vandalised a government records building across from the mayor's office, leaving computers and documents in the street.", "Organisers of the protest called for the \"immediate resignation\" of\u00a0Mr Kabore.", "\"Since he\u00a0is in power, terrorists are spreading desolation in this country and he is incapable of finding a solution to this problem,\" said Valentin Yamkoudougou, spokesperson for the Save Burkina Faso\u00a0movement that organised the protest.", "Mr Kabore promised in a speech to the nation on Thursday to end \"dysfunction\" within the military after reports the gendarmes at the base near Inata had run out of food weeks before the attack.", "The public's angry response to the latest attacks has unnerved the authorities, who cut mobile internet access a week ago and refused to authorise Saturday's demonstration.", "The United Nations' special envoy to West Africa said on Thursday he was concerned about the situation in Burkina Faso and warned against any military takeover, following coups in three neighbouring countries over the past year.", "
Anti-French protests
", "", "
Anger has also been directed at French forces who support Mr Kabore's\u00a0government.(AP:\u00a0Sophie Garcia)
", "The unrest also comes in the wake of anti-French protests last week, where at least four people were injured when French forces fired warning shots at protesters in Kaya.", "For nearly a week, the protesters had blocked a French military convoy coming from Ivory Coast that was trying to pass into Niger.\u00a0", "While Saturday's protest was mostly against the government, anti-French protesters threw rocks at foreigners as well. \u00a0", "The government's crackdown follows a week of mobile internet shutdown, which the government said was for national security reasons.\u00a0", "The President vowed to increase aid to the military and investigate the deaths in the Sahel while calling on the population to stay calm.", "But anger across the country is mounting, with more protests planned in the coming weeks.\u00a0", "Earlier this month, the opposition gave the President a one-month ultimatum to stem the violence or said it would begin protests demanding the president's\u00a0resignation.", "ABC/wires"]
